page.title: 08Bourtie Deliveries
page.content: Although most of Bourtie lies within two miles of a town, either Oldmeldrum or Inverurie, it is still makedly a country place, with most of the 265 residents involved in farming; this has in the past ment that while the husband and son are out on the tractor or with the animals, and the children are at school, transported by the school bus, the farm wife has remained at home preparing food or minding the household. Little change has filtered in an although the wife may be able to drive a car (in many cases she cannot or does not), there is only one car per family and the couple usually drive together on Friday, farmers' market day, to Huntly or Aberdeen for weekly supplies. Consequently there are four vans which deliver bread, fish, meat and lemonade weekly to farms.
